up.front is a user group focused on web design & frontend development topics, based in Berlin. Every month we meet at co.up, a co-working space in Kreuzberg, where we discuss everything related to webdesign and frontend development. Everyone is welcome to participate, either by attending or holding a talk themselves. We are very much looking forward to your talk proposals, be it a keynote or a 5 minute chat about your latest find on the web.

Tuesday, April 10th 2012, 7:30 pm

It’s up.front 25! Spring is here, and so is our first Really Rather Big Number™ meetup. We’ve found some great speakers for our 25th edition, and we’re very much looking forward to both you and them.

As always, up.front takes place in the comfy confines of the co.up co-working space in Kreuzberg, Adalbertstraße 7-8, on the 10th of April at 19:30. Co.up offers a variety of cheap drinks and the biggest beanbags we’ve ever seen.

Found out about a cool new tool or technology? Want to talk about a project that fits into the web design or frontend category? Share it with everyone and hold a talk! Plus: you’re always welcome to hold a more or less spontaneous lightning talk.

Spread the word, show us cool stuff, learn new things at up.front.ug!

Follow us on Twitter for updates and RSVP on Facebook or Plancast.

  • Kelly Sutton, LayerVault: From MVP to business in 9 months

    LayerVault started as a Quora thread. "What are the tools or methods to manage design files?" Allan Grinshtein sent Kelly Sutton (me) an IM, "Man it sucks to be a designer. Think you could build something?" Sutton had a prototype ready to show off the next Monday. Nine months later, they are used by the best designers worldwide.

    While the days of LayerVault are still extremely early, there are quite a few lessons learned. Is "just ship it" always the best advice? What’s the best way to deal with copycats? How can I work as fast as humanly possible?

    Kelly Sutton is a software developer from New York City. He’s currently traveling the world. In the past, he’s made HackCollege and the Cult of Less and worked for blip.tv and Gilt Groupe.

    • layervault.com
    • layervault.tumblr.com
    • @layervault

  • Till Wiedeck, HelloMe: Big Pictures, Small Things

    Till will be talking about the development of dynamic visual systems, approaching projects from a cross media perspective, ideas led design, trusting the process and the gain of not fearing failure.

    Till Wiedeck is the founder of Berlin based design studio HelloMe.

    • www.tillwiedeck.com
